derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French parc, from medieval Latin parricus, of Germanic origin; related to German Pferch 'pen, fold', also to paddock. The word was originally a legal term designating land held by royal grant for keeping game animals: this was enclosed and therefore distinct from a forest or chase, and (also unlike a forest) had no special laws or officers. A military sense 'space occupied by artillery, wagons, stores, etc. in an encampment' (late 17th cent.) is the origin of the verb sense (mid 19th cent.) and of sense 2 (early 20th cent.)

entry.def: A park is a public area of land with grass and trees, usually in a town, where people go in order to relax and enjoy themselves.

example.ex: ...a brisk walk with the dog around the park...
example.tran: 牵着狗在公园里轻快地散步

entry.def: When you park a vehicle or park somewhere, you drive the vehicle into a position where it can stay for a period of time, and leave it there.

example.ex: Greenfield turned into the next side street and parked...
example.tran: 格林菲尔德转进下一个小巷，停好车。

example.ex: He found a place to park the car...

entry.def: You can refer to a place where a particular activity is carried out as a park .
A private area of grass and trees around a large country house is referred to as a park .

example.ex: ...a 19th century manor house in six acres of park and woodland.
example.tran: 位于6英亩园林和树林中的19世纪庄园宅第

entry.def: Some people refer to a football or rugby field as the park .

example.ex: Chris was also the best player on the park.
example.tran: 克里斯同时也是场上的最佳球员。

entry.tran: 棒球场（亦用于某些棒球场名称中）
entry.def: A park is a park or stadium where baseball is played. Park is also used in the names of some parks.

example.ex: ...a spot where professional baseball has been played in one park or another since 1896...
example.tran: 自1896年以来其中多个棒球场举办过职业棒球赛的地方

example.ex: The network was broadcasting the World Series from Candlestick Park when the quake struck.
example.tran: 地震发生时，该电视网正在烛台棒球场直播世界系列赛。

means.word_mean: 1. a large area of land preserved in its natural state as public property;

sentences.sentence: "there are laws that protect the wildlife in this park"

means.word_mean: 2. a piece of open land for recreational use in an urban area;

sentences.sentence: "they went for a walk in the park"

means.word_mean: 3. a facility in which ball games are played (especially baseball games);
4. a lot where cars are parked
5. a gear position that acts as a parking brake;

sentences.sentence: "the put the car in park and got out"

means.word_mean: 2. maneuver a vehicle into a parking space;

sentences.sentence: "Park the car in front of the library"
